titleInfo.title: Children and Federal Health Care Cuts: A National Survey of the Impact of Federal Health Budget Reductions on State Maternal and Child Health Services During 1982

location.physicalLocation: Langston Hughes Library (Children's Defense Fund Haley Farm)

mods.abstract: To determine whether the Reagan Administration's claim that Fiscal Year 1982 budget cuts would reduce only duplicative and wasteful services and not affect the truly needy, CDF initiated a national survey of changes in state maternal and child health services in 49 states (Nebraska did not respond to the Title V portion of CDF's survey) and the District of Columbia to assess the FY 1982 budget cuts' effects on children and families. The survey focused on Medicaid, the Title V Maternal and Child Health Block Grant, and the Community Health Centers Program because they represent the largest sources of federal health funds for mothers and children, are interdependent, and are the health care "providers of last resort" for the poor. The disturbing findings of this survey are included in this report.
